original: ston te / bcom ldan 'das /

translated: here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving should first of all, aiming at the knowledge of all aspects, give gifts.

original: gal te byang @4a *//
analyzed: gal te byang @4a *//

analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs par bgyis nas sbyin pa byin na /

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /

analyzed: ci'i phyir na de byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jigs pa yin par shes par bya /

analyzed: smras pa / nyan thos rnams dang 'bras bu mnyam par 'gyur du 'ong bas na de'i phyir de'i 'jigs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: He replied, “Because it would be equal to the result of the śrāvakas, therefore it should be understood as its danger.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said to the Venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byin pa gang yin pa dang / nyan thos dgra bcom pa mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa sbyin pa byin pa gang yin pa 'di la bye brag ni ci yod /

translated: what is the difference between the generosity practiced by a bodhisattva and the generosity practiced by a śrāvaka arhat who wishes to actualize [nirvāṇa]?

original: tha dad du dbye ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: tha dad du dbye ba ni gang yin /
translated: What is the distinction?”

original: smras @4b pa; tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras @4b pa; tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: tha dad du dbye ba ni 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: tha dad du dbye ba ni 'di nyid yin te /
translated: this itself is the distinction:

original: gcig ni gang nyan thos kyi sar yongs su bsngo bar byed la /
analyzed: gcig ni gang nyan thos kyi sar yongs su bsngo bar byed la /
translated: one is dedicated to the level of the śrāvakas,

original: cig shos ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: cig shos ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar byed pa yin no //
translated: while the other is dedicated to omniscience.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dper na / skyes bu la la zhig bdag rgyal por gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam du rgyal po'i sa la dmigs nas sbyin pa byin la; skyes bu cig shos ni bdag rgyal po de'i yul na gnas kyang ci ma rung snyam du mngag gzhug par khas len par 'dod de
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu la la zhig bdag rgyal por gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam du rgyal po'i sa la dmigs nas sbyin pa byin la; skyes bu cig shos ni bdag rgyal po de'i yul na gnas kyang ci ma rung snyam du mngag gzhug par khas len par 'dod de
translated: it is like this: Suppose one person, thinking, ‘Wouldn’t it be good if I were a king,’ were to give gifts with the aim of becoming a king, and another person were to agree to be a servant in the realm of that king.

original: sbyin pa byin zhing de ltar yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin zhing de ltar yongs su bsngo na /
translated: If he were to give gifts and dedicate them in that way,

original: skyes bu des skyes bu snga ma des dmigs pa'i rgyal po'i sa gang yin pa de nyid non par nus sam /
analyzed: skyes bu des skyes bu snga ma des dmigs pa'i rgyal po'i sa gang yin pa de nyid non par nus sam /
translated: would that person be able to attain the status of a king aimed at by the other person?

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs nas sbyin pa byin zhing yongs su bsngo la /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs nas sbyin pa byin zhing yongs su bsngo la /
translated: in the same way, bodhisattva great beings give gifts with the aim of the knowledge of all aspects, and dedicate them.

analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa ni sbyin pa gang byin pa de nyan thos kyi sa la dgra bcom pa pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: The one who is a śrāvaka vehicle practitioner dedicates the generosity that he practices to the state of an arhat in the śrāvaka vehicle.

analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa nyan thos byang chub sems dpa'i nye gnas su 'gyur bar 'dod na /
translated: In that way, if the noble one who is a śrāvaka wants to be a bodhisattva’s attendant,

analyzed: skyes bu des sbyin pa de nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar byed pa'i mthu dang / nus pa yod dam /

original: yang tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: yang tshe dang ldan pa gang po /

analyzed: mos pa gang dang ldan pas sbyin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa @5a *//

analyzed: nyid du yongs su bsngo ba'i mos pa de ni med kyi /
translated: does not exist.

original: sbyin pa de nyan thos su yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dgra bcom pa'i sa la gnas pa'i tha dad du dbye ba yin no //

translated: The dedication of that generosity to the śrāvaka vehicle is the distinction between the one who is a practitioner of the bodhisattva vehicle and the one who is a practitioner of the śrāvaka vehicle who is on the level of an arhat.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: dper na / skyes bu la la zhig sbyin pa 'dis bdag tshong dpon nam /
translated: some person gives a gift with the thought, “By this gift, may I become a guild master,

analyzed: khyim bdag gam / tshangs par gyur cig ces sbyin pa byin pa de bzhin du nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i sbyin par blta'o // de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: a householder,🔽or a Brahmā.”🔽Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

analyzed: 'di ni ngo mtshar che ste /
translated: this is amazing!

original: sh'a radva ti'i bus shin tu legs par smras so //
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bus shin tu legs par smras so //
translated: Śāradvatīputra has spoken very well.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dper na / skyes bu la la zhig k'arsh'a pa na 'bum khyer te /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu la la zhig k'arsh'a pa na 'bum khyer te /
translated: for example, suppose some person, carrying a hundred thousand gold coins,

analyzed: khyim bdag phyug po gang yang rung ba zhig gi drung du song nas /
translated: approached any wealthy householder

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i sems can rnams dud 'gro'i skye gnas nas 'don par gyur cig /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i sems can rnams dud 'gro'i skye gnas nas 'don par gyur cig /
translated: May all beings born as animals be freed from the animal realm.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams gshin rje'i 'jig rten nas 'don par gyur cig /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams gshin rje'i 'jig rten nas 'don par gyur cig /
translated: May all beings in the world of the Lord of Death be freed from the world of the Lord of Death.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag gnas pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gyur cig /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag gnas pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gyur cig /
translated: May all the bodhisattva great beings who have newly entered the vehicle and are dwelling in infinite and limitless world systems become irreversible.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gnas pa de dag ni myur du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gnas pa de dag ni myur du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: May all irreversible bodhisattvas quickly perfect the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bskyed pa de lta de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bskyed pa de lta de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
translated: The more a bodhisattva cultivates these wholesome actions, the more he or she will take up the perfection of generosity.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu med pa'ang rnam par 'phel bar byed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu med pa'ang rnam par 'phel bar byed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The more he or she will increase immeasurable wholesome actions and come closer to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as a bodhisattva’s skillful means.

original: ji lta ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la bdag gi bar 'du shes mi byed pa de lta de ltar @11b bsod nams dpag tu med pa mngon par 'du byed pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la bdag gi bar 'du shes mi byed pa de lta de ltar @11b bsod nams dpag tu med pa mngon par 'du byed pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: The more a bodhisattva does not think of wholesome actions as his or her own, the more he or she will take up immeasurable merit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the knowledge of all aspects is immeasurable.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa!

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva gives away all his possessions.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gzugs med pa gang yin pa'ang yongs su gtong na gzugs yod pa'i dngos po lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gzugs med pa gang yin pa'ang yongs su gtong na gzugs yod pa'i dngos po lta ci smos te /
translated: He gives away even the roots of virtue that are formless, let alone material things that have form.

analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba yin te /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva gives away all things, both those that have form and those that are formless.

original: thams cad yongs su gtong bas na de thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad yongs su gtong bas na de thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he gives away everything, he becomes omniscient.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /

analyzed: gzugs yod pa'am / gzugs med pa'ang rung ste; gang bdag gis yongs su ma btang ba'am / ma byin pa'am /
translated: whether having form or formless,🔽I do not see any phenomenon that I have not given away,🔽that I have not offered,

analyzed: mchod sbyin ma byas pa'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /

analyzed: dngos po de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see that thing.”

original: zhes kyang seng ge'i sgra sgrog cing de ltar dga' ba skyed do //
analyzed: zhes kyang seng ge'i sgra sgrog cing de ltar dga' ba skyed do //
translated: Thus, he roars the lion’s roar and generates such joy.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis gzigs te /
translated: when bodhisattva mahāsattva genuinely realizes unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and sees with the wisdom of omniscience,

analyzed: 'di skad du / nang gi'am / phyi rol gyi'am /
translated: he says:

original: gzugs yod @12a *//
analyzed: gzugs yod @12a *//
translated: ‘I do not see any phenomenon, whether internal or external,

original: pa'am; gzugs med pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: pa'am; gzugs med pa'ang rung ste /
translated: whether form or formless,

original: gang bdag gis yongs su ma btang ba'am /
analyzed: gang bdag gis yongs su ma btang ba'am /
translated: that I have not relinquished,

analyzed: ma byin pa'am /

analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag gis dngos po de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i phyir bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Because I do not see that thing, I will genuinely realize unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and,

analyzed: gang bdag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'am /
translated: I have not yet fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽

analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

translated: Just as I do not see any phenomenon that I have not fully awakened to or that I have not thoroughly known, in the same way, after I have fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood, I will attain the highest perfection in all phenomena.

analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa de ci'ang med do // ji ltar gang bdag gis yongs su ma btang ba'am / ma byin pa de ci'ang med pa de ltar bdag gis chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'am /
translated: There is nothing at all that I have not fully awakened to or that I have not thoroughly known.🔽Just as there is nothing at all that I have not given up or that I have not given away, in the same way, I do not see any phenomenon that I have not fully awakened to or that I have not thoroughly known.

original: yongs su ma shes pa'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes seng ge'i sgra sgrog go /
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes seng ge'i sgra sgrog go /
translated: Thus, I roar the lion’s roar.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar nang dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams yongs su btang bas na /🔽@12b nang dang / phyi'i chos rnams la chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar nang dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams yongs su btang bas na / @12b nang dang / phyi'i chos rnams la chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'am /
translated: “In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being gives up inner and outer things.🔽He does not see any inner or outer thing that he has not fully awakened to or fully known.

analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa'i chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: He does not see any thing at all that he has not fully awakened to or fully known.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva great being should train in the perfection of giving like that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar slob na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming thob cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang yang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ro //

translated: If the bodhisattva trains like that, he will obtain the name ‘bodhisattva’ and will not be separated from the thought of the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' la bdud sdig can gyis kyang glags mi rnyed na /🔽gnod sbyin nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' la bdud sdig can gyis kyang glags mi rnyed na / gnod sbyin nam /
translated: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is never separate from the mind of omniscience, then even Māra, the evil one, will find no opportunity to harm that bodhisattva.

original: sha zas glags rnyed pa lta ci smos te 'di ni gnas med do; ;tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽phyogs gang du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos sems shing 'gro ba'i phyogs der mi'am /

translated: What need is there to speak of yakṣas or piśācas finding an opportunity? That is impossible.

original: mi ma yin pa rnams kyis glags mi rnyed do //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa rnams kyis glags mi rnyed do //
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, in whatever direction a bodhisattva who is contemplating the Dharma of omniscience goes, in that direction neither humans nor non-humans will find an opportunity to harm them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag ni de ltar stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa rnams ni de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab cing de ltar rgya che'o //
translated: In that way, the mental engagements of omniscience are inconceivable and vast.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa ni de ltar sems can rnams la @13a *//
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing for awakening should be like that toward sentient beings.

original: phan 'dogs pa'ang yin la nye bar 'tsho ba'ang yin no //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'ang yin la nye bar 'tsho ba'ang yin no //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who practice for the sake of enlightenment are thus benefactors and providers for sentient beings.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: by this method, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva surpasses all foolish ordinary beings, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang phan 'dogs par gyur pa dang / nye bar 'tsho ba yin no //
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, they become benefactors and providers.

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir chos kyang ston to //
translated: They also teach the Dharma in order to eliminate the afflictions of sentient beings.

analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa'ang phung po gsum du yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar byed do //
translated: They cause countless sentient beings to attain nirvāṇa in the three vehicles.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

translated: śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: gtso bo dang / phul dang / rab dang / rab mchog dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the chief, the best, the excellent, the sublime, the unsurpassed, and the unequaled.

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang sems can rnams kyi phan 'dogs par gyur pa dang / nye bar 'tsho ba yin te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nam yang sems can rnams kyi nye bar 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //

analyzed: yod ces bya ba ni gnas med do //

original: snod 'di dag ji ltar yang dag par bya snyam du sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: snod 'di dag ji ltar yang dag par bya snyam du sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not think, “How can I fill these vessels?”

original: ji ltar sems bskyed par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems bskyed par bya zhe na /
translated: How should he think?

original: sbyin no snod 'di dag dgang bar spro bar bya'o //🔽ji ltar snod 'di dag dgang bar bya ba de lta de ltar 'bad do //
analyzed: sbyin no snod 'di dag dgang bar spro bar bya'o // ji ltar snod 'di dag dgang bar bya ba de lta de ltar 'bad do //
translated: “I will give! I am happy to fill these vessels!”🔽“I will strive in whatever way I can to fill these vessels!”

original: de lta de ltar btsal lo snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta de ltar btsal lo snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “I will search in whatever way I can!”

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta de ltar 'bad cing 'tshol la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta de ltar 'bad cing 'tshol la /
translated: If the bodhisattva mahāsattva strives and searches in that way,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom ste yongs su gtong na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom ste yongs su gtong na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: If one practices generosity while striving with diligence, one will perfect the perfection of generosity.

original: tshe dang ldan @17a *//🔽pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan @17a *// pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: in this way the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of generosity.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can la snying brtse bas sbyin pa byin par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can la snying brtse bas sbyin pa byin par bya'o //
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should practice generosity with compassion for sentient beings.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje la gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje la gnas par bya ste /
translated: One should abide in love and compassion

original: sems can rnams la sbyin pa byin par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sbyin pa byin par bya'o //
translated: and practice generosity toward sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa byin pa na /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa na /
translated: When practicing generosity,

original: 'di ltar gang 'di las bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa dang / dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'i bsod nams dang / dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa des 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gnas pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gyur cig /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang 'di las bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa dang / dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'i bsod nams dang / dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa des 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gnas pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gyur cig /
translated: In this way, by the merit and virtue of this creation of merit and this creation of virtue, may the bodhisattvas who are beginners in the limitless, endless world systems become irreversible.

original: phyir mi ldog pa gang dag gnas pa de dag ni myur du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa gang dag gnas pa de dag ni myur du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: And may those who are irreversible quickly complete the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su gtong ba de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'bogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su gtong ba de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'bogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the more the bodhisattva mahāsattva gives away those wholesome roots, the more the bodhisattva mahāsattva penetrates omniscience.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dper na / gser ni ji lta ji ltar bsregs pa dang / bzhu ba dang / bskol ba dang / tshos @17b par byas pa de lta de ltar shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / gser ni ji lta ji ltar bsregs pa dang / bzhu ba dang / bskol ba dang / tshos @17b par byas pa de lta de ltar shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, the more gold is refined, melted, and worked by an expert goldsmith, the more it becomes pliable, workable, and radiant, and the more it is fit for making any kind of ornament.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang ji lta ji ltar bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa dang / dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis 'bogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang ji lta ji ltar bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa dang / dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis 'bogs so //
translated: in the same way, the more a bodhisattva-mahāsattva dedicates the creation of merit and virtue to omniscience, the more those roots of virtue are refined.

original: ji lta ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis 'bogs pa de lta de ltar sems can rnams kyis bsnyen pa'i 'os su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis 'bogs pa de lta de ltar sems can rnams kyis bsnyen pa'i 'os su 'gyur zhing /
translated: The more those roots of virtue are refined, the more they become fit to be approached by sentient beings,

original: kha dog dang / 'od dang / gzi brjid kyis kyang shin tu gzi brjid che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang / 'od dang / gzi brjid kyis kyang shin tu gzi brjid che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the more they become endowed with great splendor, radiance, and majesty.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dper na / bud med me long gi byi dor byed pa na ji lta ji ltar me long gi byi dor byed pa de lta de ltar shin tu 'od gsal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na / bud med me long gi byi dor byed pa na ji lta ji ltar me long gi byi dor byed pa de lta de ltar shin tu 'od gsal bar 'gyur la /
translated: For example, when a woman is cleaning a mirror, the more she cleans it, the more it becomes very clear.

original: ji lta ji ltar shin tu 'od gsal bar gyur pa de lta de ltar bzhin gsal bar rab tu snang ngo //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar shin tu 'od gsal bar gyur pa de lta de ltar bzhin gsal bar rab tu snang ngo //
translated: And the more it becomes very clear, the more the face appears clearly.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,🔽in the same way, the more a bodhisattva great being dedicates the merit that has arisen from generosity to omniscience,🔽and the more he or she gives it away to other bodhisattvas,🔽the more the bodhisattva’s merit increases.🔽The more it increases, the more the bodhisattva’s face of the perfection of wisdom appears clearly.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang ji lta ji ltar sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang ji lta ji ltar sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing /
translated: The more it appears clearly, the more the bodhisattva’s face of the perfection of wisdom appears clearly.

original: de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la'ang yongs su gtong ste /🔽gang dag theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gyur cig /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la'ang yongs su gtong ste / gang dag theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gyur cig /

original: phyir mi ldog pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni myur du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs @18a *//
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni myur du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs @18a *//
translated: The more it appears clearly, the more the bodhisattva’s face of the perfection of wisdom appears

original: par gyur cig ces ji lta ji ltar yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pa de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rgya che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par gyur cig ces ji lta ji ltar yongs su gtong zhing sbyin pa de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rgya che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the more he gives and the more he dedicates, the more his roots of virtue will increase.

original: ji lta ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rgya che bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rgya che bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur te /
translated: And the more his roots of virtue increase, the closer he will get to the knowledge of all modes.🔽In this way a Bodhisattva should be known as skilled in means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yongs su bsngo ba ni thabs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o; ;ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa chung ngu byin na bsod nams mang po skyed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yongs su bsngo ba ni thabs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o; ;ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa chung ngu byin na bsod nams mang po skyed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does a Bodhisattva, by giving a little, produce much merit?

original: gal te sbyin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo na /
translated: If he dedicates that gift to the knowledge of all modes,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa chung ngu byin la bsod nams mang po bskyed do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa chung ngu byin la bsod nams mang po bskyed do //
translated: then the Bodhisattva, by giving a little, produces much merit.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar mi byed na /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar mi byed na /
translated: How is it that they do not dedicate their generosity to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: de ltar sbyin pa mang po byin la /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa mang po byin la /
translated: In this way, they give many gifts,

original: bsod nams nyung du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams nyung du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: but generate little merit.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gnas te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gnas te /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings were to live for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river,

original: bde bar sbyar ba'i yo byad mang po yongs su gtong la /
analyzed: bde bar sbyar ba'i yo byad mang po yongs su gtong la /
translated: and were to give away many things that are conducive to happiness,

original: sbyin pa de'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar byed na /
analyzed: sbyin pa de'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar byed na /
translated: and were to dedicate that generosity to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa mang po byin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa mang po byin zhing /
translated: in this way, bodhisattva great beings would give many gifts,

original: bsod nams mang pos khyed do //
analyzed: bsod nams mang pos khyed do //
translated: and generate much merit.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
translated: Therefore, when bodhisattva great beings give gifts,

original: rnam @18b pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang ma bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam @18b pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang ma bral bar bya'o //
translated: they should not be separated from keeping in mind the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub dang nye ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub dang nye ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is not separated from keeping in mind the knowledge of all aspects is close to enlightenment.

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs par byed pa ni thabs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs par byed pa ni thabs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is focused on the knowledge of all aspects is skilled in means.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog ma nyid du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog ma nyid du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, Venerable Pūrṇa, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva should first train in the perfection of giving.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gang gi phyir des 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas ser sna bsten te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir des 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas ser sna bsten te /
translated: Because of that, from beginningless cyclic existence, stinginess has been relied upon.

original: de sbyin pa de yongs su gtong na ser sna rgyang ring bar byed cing /
analyzed: de sbyin pa de yongs su gtong na ser sna rgyang ring bar byed cing /
translated: If that one gives that gift, stinginess is sent far away,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar byed do //
translated: and one approaches the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ji lta ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar byed pa de lta de ltar nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las ldog par byed do //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar byed pa de lta de ltar nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las ldog par byed do //
translated: To the extent that one approaches the knowledge of all aspects, to that extent one turns away from the śrāvaka level and the pratyekabuddha level.

original: ji lta ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las ldog pa de lta de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las ldog pa de lta de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that one turns away from the śrāvaka level and the pratyekabuddha level, to that extent one approaches the knowledge of all aspects.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dper na / char pa 'bab pa'i tshe bla gab med par bum pa bzhag pa de rim @19a *//
analyzed: dper na / char pa 'bab pa'i tshe bla gab med par bum pa bzhag pa de rim @19a *//
translated: for example, when it rains, a pot is placed outside.

original: gyis thigs pa bab pas gang bar gyur na dang por thigs pa bab pa gang yin pa dang / tha mar thigs pa bab pa gang yin pa nyi tshes bum pa de gang bar gyur pa ma yin gyi; de'i bar gyi chu'i thigs pa rgyun ma chad par rim gyis bab pa'i chu'i thigs pa rnams kyis bum pa de gang ba yin no //
analyzed: gyis thigs pa bab pas gang bar gyur na dang por thigs pa bab pa gang yin pa dang / tha mar thigs pa bab pa gang yin pa nyi tshes bum pa de gang bar gyur pa ma yin gyi; de'i bar gyi chu'i thigs pa rgyun ma chad par rim gyis bab pa'i chu'i thigs pa rnams kyis bum pa de gang ba yin no //
translated: The pot is filled by the uninterrupted stream of water drops that fall in between.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dang po sems bskyed pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dang po sems bskyed pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'ang ma yin /
translated: in the same way, a bodhisattva great being does not attain the knowledge of all aspects by the first production of the thought,

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pas kyang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pas kyang ma yin gyi /
translated: nor by the one sitting on the seat of awakening.

original: dang po sems bskyed pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i sems bskyed pa phyi ma'i de'i bar gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyi khyad par bskyed pa /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i sems bskyed pa phyi ma'i de'i bar gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyi khyad par bskyed pa /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is attained by the uninterrupted stream of the special qualities of thought connected with the knowledge of all aspects that arise between the first production of the thought and the production of the thought of one sitting on the seat of awakening.

original: phan par gyur pa bsags pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rim gyis 'bras bu bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: phan par gyur pa bsags pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rim gyis 'bras bu bskyed pa yin no //
translated: All of them, having accumulated what is beneficial, will gradually give rise to the fruit of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de ltar na 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ma 'dres pa'i sems kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ma 'dres pa'i sems kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs par bya'o //
translated: in this way, here the bodhisattva mahāsattvas should focus on the knowledge of all aspects with an unadulterated mind.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos /
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇī­putra

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems ma 'dres pa yin /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems ma 'dres pa yin /
translated: to what extent is the mind of a bodhisattva unadulterated?”

original: smras @19b pa; tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras @19b pa; tshe dang ldan pa gang po /

analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bar chad byed par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag 'byung bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems 'dres pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //

original: yid la byed pa de dag ci'i phyir 'dod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag ci'i phyir 'dod par bya zhe na /

analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: In the same way, he should practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of effort, and the perfection of meditation.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug par ma gyur gyi bar du 'dod par bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams la'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su skyo ba'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ci'i phyir 'dod par bya zhe na /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'phel ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /

analyzed: zhan par 'gyur ro //

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems de dang / shes pa gang yin pa de'ang byang chub sems dpa' la phan 'dogs par gyur pa yin te /
translated: The thought and cognition of an arhat are also conducive to the enlightenment of a bodhisattva.

original: gal te de med na de las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de med na de las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would be the opposite of that.

original: 'di lta bur dgra bcom pa'i sems bskyed pa mi bya yi /
analyzed: 'di lta bur dgra bcom pa'i sems bskyed pa mi bya yi /
translated: One should not generate the thought of an arhat in this way.

original: shes pa gcig pa zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig pa zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not called the single cognition.

original: des de spangs nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba gang yin pa der sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: des de spangs nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba gang yin pa der sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Having abandoned that, one should generate the thought that becomes omniscience.

original: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan 'dogs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan 'dogs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the thought and cognition of a pratyekabuddha are also conducive to the omniscience of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: gal te dgra bcom pa gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas gang yin pa'i sems dang / shes pa zhes bya ba de med du zin na phan 'dogs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dgra bcom pa gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas gang yin pa'i sems dang / shes pa zhes bya ba de med du zin na phan 'dogs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind and cognition of the arhats and pratyekabuddhas did not exist, then they would not be able to benefit others.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sems dang / thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sems dang / thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The mind of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is a mind that is both with and without outflows, and it is not shared in common.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems ma gtogs bar byang chub sems dpa'i sems nyid de ltar de dag gi mchog ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems ma gtogs bar byang chub sems dpa'i sems nyid de ltar de dag gi mchog ces bya ba nas /
translated: Except for the mind of the Tathāgata, the mind of the bodhisattva is the highest of all the other minds.

original: gong na med pa zhes bya ba'i @25b bar dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod do //
analyzed: gong na med pa zhes bya ba'i @25b bar dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod do //
translated: It is said to be unsurpassed, and it is equal to the unequaled.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa!

original: de lta bas na 'di gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan 'dogs par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan 'dogs par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, these two are of benefit to the omniscience of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ltar na 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan par ma gyur pa'i chos de gang yang mi dmigs so ////🔽bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan par ma gyur pa'i chos de gang yang mi dmigs so //// bam po gnyis pa /
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas do not observe any phenomenon that is not of benefit to the omniscience of those skilled in means.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of generosity,

original: dngos po gang yongs su gtong ba'i dngos po de la mtshan ma'i 'du shes mi bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang yongs su gtong ba'i dngos po de la mtshan ma'i 'du shes mi bya'o //
translated: they should not perceive any object that is given as having characteristics.

original: de ltar mtshan ma med par yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma med par yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: In this way, they give without characteristics

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo na /
translated: and dedicate it to omniscience.

original: phan 'dogs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it is of benefit.

original: mtshan ma ma spangs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan ma ma spangs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One will not attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening without abandoning the signs.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnyed pa nyid ni rnyed pa che ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnyed pa nyid ni rnyed pa che ba yin no //
translated: The attainment of omniscience is the great attainment.

original: bya ba dag gis gser bye ba'am /
analyzed: bya ba dag gis gser bye ba'am /
translated: The gathering of a hundred thousand actions,

original: rin po che bye ba 'du ba gang yin pa de ni rnyed pa che ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rin po che bye ba 'du ba gang yin pa de ni rnyed pa che ba ma yin gyi /
translated: or a hundred thousand jewels, is not the great attainment.

original: gang mtshan ma med par dngos po yongs su btang nas /
analyzed: gang mtshan ma med par dngos po yongs su btang nas /
translated: But the abandonment of things without signs,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba 'di nyid rnyed pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //🔽gang mtshan ma yongs su ma spangs @26a *//
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba 'di nyid rnyed pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin no // gang mtshan ma yongs su ma spangs @26a *//
translated: and the full awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is the special attainment.

original: par gling chen po bzhir 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid thob par gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: par gling chen po bzhir 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid thob par gyur du zin kyang /
translated: Even if one were to attain the sovereignty of a wheel-turning king over the four great continents without abandoning the signs,

original: de ni rnyed pa chen po ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni rnyed pa chen po ma yin la /
translated: that would not be the great attainment.

original: mtshan ma ma spangs par 'dod pa'i khams su bdag po'i bya ba byed du 'jug pa 'di'ang rnyed pa chen por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma spangs par 'dod pa'i khams su bdag po'i bya ba byed du 'jug pa 'di'ang rnyed pa chen por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not a great gain to be in the desire realm, not having abandoned the signs, and to be made to perform the activity of a lord.

original: gal te mtshan ma yongs su spangs nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'am /
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma yongs su spangs nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'am /
translated: If, having abandoned the signs, one attains the fruit of stream-entry,🔽the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par gyur na /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par gyur na /
translated: arhatship, or individual enlightenment,

original: 'di ni rnyed pa shin tu che ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnyed pa shin tu che ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: that should be known as a great gain.

original: gang mtshan ma yongs su spangs nas /
analyzed: gang mtshan ma yongs su spangs nas /
translated: If, having abandoned the signs,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa 'di'ang rnyed pa che ba yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa 'di'ang rnyed pa che ba yin te /
translated: one attains unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, that is also a great gain.

original: 'di ni rnyed pa snga ma de bas rnyed pa shin tu che ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnyed pa snga ma de bas rnyed pa shin tu che ba ste /
translated: This is a greater gain than the previous gain.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnyed pa 'di ni mnyam pa'i zla med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnyed pa 'di ni mnyam pa'i zla med de /
translated: This gain of the bodhisattva great being is without equal.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnyed pa yin no //
translated: The Tathāgatas are the supreme gain.

original: gang gos dang / kha zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad mtshan mar yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po ni bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gos dang / kha zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad mtshan mar yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po ni bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not generate things that are taken hold of as having the signs of robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for supporting the sick.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni mtshan ma'i grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma'i grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they belong to the enumeration of signs.

original: gang yang gos dang / kha zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad de'ang yongs su btang la /
analyzed: gang yang gos dang / kha zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad de'ang yongs su btang la /
translated: “One should give away those robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for supporting the sick,

original: thabs la mkhas @26b pas yongs su bsngos na /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas @26b pas yongs su bsngos na /
translated: and, through skillful means, dedicate them.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
translated: In that way, one will attain omniscience.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnyed pa mchog yin par rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' la /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnyed pa mchog yin par rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' la /
translated: Therefore, one should know that this is the supreme gain of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: “A bodhisattva should be told,

original: khyod kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘You will attain omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyod kyis gang la mtshan mar bzung ba'i dngos po de ni rnyed par dka' ba ste; nang dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis gang la mtshan mar bzung ba'i dngos po de ni rnyed par dka' ba ste; nang dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thing that you have taken as a sign is hard to get, because all things, inner and outer, are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar na khyod kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na khyod kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus you will attain omniscience.

original: gang dag gis thob pa dang / gang dag thob pa dang / thob par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyis kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi na thob bo //
analyzed: gang dag gis thob pa dang / gang dag thob pa dang / thob par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyis kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi na thob bo //
translated: Those who have attained it, those who are attaining it, and those who will attain it, all of them attain omniscience.

original: 'thob bo / thob par 'gyur ro zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'thob bo / thob par 'gyur ro zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: You should say that they have attained it, are attaining it, and will attain it.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Śāradvatī­putra asked the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇī­putra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: bgrang ba 'di byang chub sems dpa' gang gi yin smras pa; 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa'i bgrang ba yin no //
analyzed: bgrang ba 'di byang chub sems dpa' gang gi yin smras pa; 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa'i bgrang ba yin no //
translated: is this enumeration of yours the enumeration of a bodhisattva? ” He replied, “This enumeration is the enumeration of a bodhisattva skilled in means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems can 'di dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi na thob par de ltar shes su zin na ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi na thob par de ltar shes su zin na ni /
translated: If these sentient beings were to know that they will attain omniscience,

original: sems can thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then all sentient beings would attain omniscience.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ma  mos shing sems mi @27a *//
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ma  mos shing sems mi @27a *//
translated: But because they do not aspire to omniscience and do not generate the thought

original: skyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: of awakening,

original: gang dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems mi skyed pa de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems mi skyed pa de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: those who do not generate the thought of awakening will not attain omniscience.

original: gang dag 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mos shing sems bskyed pa dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mos shing sems bskyed pa dag ni /
translated: Those who aspire to omniscience and generate the thought of awakening

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: will attain omniscience.

original: sems de bskyed nas dngos po gang dang / gang yongs su gtong ba de dang / de dngos po med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems de bskyed nas dngos po gang dang / gang yongs su gtong ba de dang / de dngos po med par mthong ngo //
translated: Having generated that thought, they see that whatever thing they give away is not a thing.

original: dngos po gang dang / gang shes pa la 'di dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang dang / gang shes pa la 'di dag ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: Whatever things are known, they are like illusions.

original: 'di ni ji ltar bdag gis mtshan mar bzung ba ltar ma yin no snyam nas de gtong ba'i blo shas che bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni ji ltar bdag gis mtshan mar bzung ba ltar ma yin no snyam nas de gtong ba'i blo shas che bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thinking, ‘They are not as I have apprehended them as signs,’ the mind that gives them away becomes predominant.

original: sbyin pa'i blo dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i blo dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: They become endowed with the mind of generosity.

original: 'dzin pa'i sems mi skyed do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i sems mi skyed do //
translated: They do not give rise to the mind of grasping.

original: 'di ltar dngos po 'di ni sgyu ma lta bur sems can rnams kyis de ltar mi shes pas dngos po de dag la shas cher mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po 'di ni sgyu ma lta bur sems can rnams kyis de ltar mi shes pas dngos po de dag la shas cher mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, sentient beings do not know that things are like illusions. Therefore, they strongly cling to those things.

original: yongs su mi gtong ba'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su mi gtong ba'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: They become a mind that does not give them away.

original: yongs su mi gtong bas ser sna yongs su 'dzin to; ;ser sna des kyang ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yongs su mi gtong bas ser sna yongs su 'dzin to; ;ser sna des kyang ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because they do not give them away, they grasp at miserliness. Because of that miserliness, they are born in the lower realms.

original: dngos po de dang yang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po de dang yang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are separated from those things.

original: de ltar dngos po de'ang yongs su mi gtong zhing yongs su ma spyad la /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po de'ang yongs su mi gtong zhing yongs su ma spyad la /
translated: In that way, they do not give those things away. They do not use them.

original: dngos po de las brten nas ser sna bskyed de /
analyzed: dngos po de las brten nas ser sna bskyed de /
translated: In dependence on those things, they give rise to miserliness.

original: ngan song rnams su'ang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song rnams su'ang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be reborn in the lower realms.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pas 'di ltar shes @27b te; dngos po 'di ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pas 'di ltar shes @27b te; dngos po 'di ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: “When a bodhisattva great being who is skilled in means knows this, he thinks, ‘This thing is like an illusion.

original: yongs su gtong ba'ang sgyu ma lta bu yin pas na /
analyzed: yongs su gtong ba'ang sgyu ma lta bu yin pas na /
translated: The giving is also like an illusion.

original: sgyu ma lta bu gang yin pa de ni bdag gi'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu gang yin pa de ni bdag gi'ang ma yin /
translated: What is like an illusion is not mine.

original: yongs su gtong ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gtong ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not something to be given away.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar de sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar de sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is like an illusion.

original: de dngos po de rgya cher yongs su gtong ngo snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de dngos po de rgya cher yongs su gtong ngo snyam du sems so //
translated: I will give this thing away on a vast scale.’

original: de de yongs su gtong bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la 'dod pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de de yongs su gtong bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la 'dod pa bskyed de /
translated: “When he gives it away, he arouses a longing for the blessed buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni legs par gsung ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni legs par gsung ba /
translated: the blessed buddhas are those who speak well,

original: phyi na ci ma log par gsung ba kho na ste /
analyzed: phyi na ci ma log par gsung ba kho na ste /
translated: who speak only what is unmistaken.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos po yongs su btang bas /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos po yongs su btang bas /
translated: By giving away things that are like an illusion,

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba 'di ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba 'di ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: The defining characteristic of existence is the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag ji ltar byed na byang chub sems dpa' dngos po de dag la mngon par zhen pa mi skyed cing /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag ji ltar byed na byang chub sems dpa' dngos po de dag la mngon par zhen pa mi skyed cing /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should think, ‘The lord buddhas have done what? They have not produced attachment to those things in the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ltar de yongs su gtong ba'i blor 'gyur snyam ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de yongs su gtong ba'i blor 'gyur snyam ste /
translated: They have made their minds to give them away.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dngos po de dag dang / rkyen de dag mtshan nyid med par ston pa 'di dag ni dka' ba mdzad pa'i snyam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dngos po de dag dang / rkyen de dag mtshan nyid med par ston pa 'di dag ni dka' ba mdzad pa'i snyam du rig par bya'o //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /

analyzed: rgya bar 'dod pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rig par bya'o //

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: gal te 'di ni sh'a radva ti'i bu'i spobs pa yin no snyam du khyod kyis shes na de ltar mi blta yi /

analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sh'a radva ti'i bu smra bar zad do //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: khyod kyis gnas brtan sh'a radva ti'i bus ji skad smras pa bzhin du zungs shig //

analyzed: chongs shig / lhogs shig /

analyzed: kun chub par gyis shig /

analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las /

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar yongs su gtong ba des ci zhig yongs su btang ba lags /

analyzed: gang po / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar yongs su gtong ba des ci'ang yongs su btang ba med do //

analyzed: ji ltar yongs su btang ba med pa de bzhin du chos ci'ang thob pa med do //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: gang po / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dngos po ci'ang @28b yongs su btang ba med pa de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas kyang chos ci'ang thob pa med do //

translated: Pūrṇa, just as the bodhisattva mahāsattva has not given up anything at all, in the same way, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, there is not a single dharma that has been attained.

analyzed: gang po / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'god pa ci 'dra ba de bzhin du /

analyzed: chos kyi 'du ba'i sgo'ang de kho na dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: If the bodhisattva mahāsattva

analyzed: chos 'ga' zhig yongs su btang bar gyur na ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i chos kyang yod pa zhig thob par 'gyur na; gang po /
translated: then the bodhisattva would have attained a dharma that had been fully awakened to as unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. Pūrṇa,

analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su gtong ba byed na /

analyzed: yod pa'i chos ci'ang thob pa med do //
translated: does not attain anything at all that is a real thing.

original: gang po / dper na /
analyzed: gang po / dper na /

analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nam sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob mas sgyu ma mkhan gyi lag tu la du zhig btsongs la /

analyzed: de la sgyu ma mkhan gyis karsha pa na dag gcig mngon par sprul te byed na /

analyzed: gang po / de ltar na rin ji lta ba de bzhin du la du'ang de dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa ji lta bu yongs su btang ba de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag @29a *//
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva great being gives a gift just as it is given, and having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'ang de kho na dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: gang po / de lta bas na 'du ba ci 'dra ba de bzhin du 'god pa'ang de kho na dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i rin ci 'dra ba de bzhin du rnyed pa'ang de kho na dang 'dra ba yin no //

original: gang po / dper na /
analyzed: gang po / dper na /
translated: Pūrṇa, it is like this:

analyzed: skyes bu sgyu ma mkhan gyis shing ljon pa zhig mngon par sprul la /

analyzed: shing ljon pa de'i drung du'ang srog chags 'bum sprul te /

analyzed: srog chags de dag kyang shing ljon pa de'i 'bras bu rnams za na /

analyzed: gang po / de ni 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin du za ba po rnams kyang de kho na dang 'dra'o //

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su gtong ba ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyis 'du ba'i sgo'ang de kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su gtong ba ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyis 'du ba'i sgo'ang de kho na dang 'dra'o //

original: gang po; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang po; 'di lta ste /
translated: Pūrṇa, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis /

analyzed: ci khye'u shi ba de'i tshen bud med de la bdag gi bu shi'o snyam pa'i sems skye'am /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: gang po / de lta na ma ji lta ba de bzhin du bu'ang de kho na dang 'dra ste /
translated: “Pūrṇa, in the same way, the child is just like the mother.

analyzed: gang po / de ltar na 'dir yang chos de dag gi 'du ba'i sgo gnyis ka med do //

analyzed: gang po / 'di ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: ci khyod kyis nga ches 'ga' zhig la 'dod pa che bar mthong ngam /

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: gang po / de bzhin du ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa chos gang la'ang 'dod pa che ba med pa de bzhin du /

analyzed: khong khro ba 'ga' yang mi skye'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: Because the blessed buddhas

translated: have abandoned attachment and aversion.

original: gang @30a *// pos gsol pa /
analyzed: gang @30a *// pos gsol pa /
translated: Pūrṇa said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dngos por gang dang / gang yongs su gtong ba de dang / de nyid stong pa'am /

analyzed: ya ma brla'am /

analyzed: gsob bam / gsog tu mthong ba ni ngo mtshar lags so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ji ltar yongs su gtong ba'i thabs ma 'tshal na /

analyzed: de ltar na de ni sbyin pa nyi tsher 'gyur gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma lags so //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su gtong ba na /
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva gives,

analyzed: 'di ltar yang bdag gis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtang bar bya'o snyam du'ang sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
translated: I will also generate the thought, ‘In this way, I will give away all my possessions.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:

analyzed: bstan pa 'di'i don bshad pa'i phyir spobs par gyis shig /
translated: “Speak with eloquence to explain the meaning of this teaching.

analyzed: ngas bshad pa'i dus la bab pa na'ang bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will also explain when the time comes for me to explain.”

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par @30b rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas chos thams cad stong par yid la byed cing sbyin pa byin par bya'o //

translated: here a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should give gifts with the mind that all phenomena are empty.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs par byas nas /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs par byas nas /
translated: Having focused on omniscience,

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang bar bya'o //
translated: I will give away all my possessions.
