analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Śāriputra,🔽it is so,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems ni zad par byar mi nus so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems ni zad par byar mi nus so //
translated: The mind of the irreversible bodhisattva cannot be exhausted.

original: sbyin pa'i pa rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pa rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Generosity,🔽it is said:

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'i le'u ste bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'i le'u ste bdun pa'o ////
translated: This was the seventh chapter, “The Stage of Nonregression,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang bos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang bos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: rnam grangs gang gis na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis na /
translated: by what method

original: phyir mi ldog @41b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems zad par byar mi nus /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog @41b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems zad par byar mi nus /
translated: can the mind of a bodhisattva great being who is irreversible not be exhausted?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa gang dang / gang byin pa na de thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs nas sbyin par byed de /🔽de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems zad par bya ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa gang dang / gang byin pa na de thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs nas sbyin par byed de / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems zad par bya ba'am /
translated: it is because when a bodhisattva great being gives a gift, whatever it is, he gives it while focusing on the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Therefore the mind of a bodhisattva great being cannot be exhausted

original: zil gyis mnan par mi nus so //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan par mi nus so //
translated: or overcome.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dper na / skyes bu tshong pa zhig zong 'bum phrag mang po spyod cing de tshong byed la /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu tshong pa zhig zong 'bum phrag mang po spyod cing de tshong byed la /
translated: For example, a merchant, a man, would engage in many hundreds of thousands of transactions.

original: tshong pa des tshong dpon nam /
analyzed: tshong pa des tshong dpon nam /
translated: That merchant would be protected by a guild master or a caravan leader.

original: ded dpon gang yang rung ba las lo 'bum phrag mang po zhig nas skyin po blangs pa las /
analyzed: ded dpon gang yang rung ba las lo 'bum phrag mang po zhig nas skyin po blangs pa las /
translated: After many hundreds of thousands of years, he would get his money back.

original: de'i tshong ma rung bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i tshong ma rung bar gyur nas /
translated: But his business would not be successful.

original: des rgyal po la bskor te rgyal po'i gan du song ngo //
analyzed: des rgyal po la bskor te rgyal po'i gan du song ngo //
translated: He would go to the king and report to the king.

original: de rgyal po'i dpung des na rgyal pos yongs su bzung ba'i mi de la tshong dpon de dang / ded dpon des tshugs par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de rgyal po'i dpung des na rgyal pos yongs su bzung ba'i mi de la tshong dpon de dang / ded dpon des tshugs par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: Because of that king’s protection, that man who was protected by the king would not be harmed by that guild master or that caravan leader.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar de dpung dang ldan pa'i phyogs /
analyzed: de ltar de dpung dang ldan pa'i phyogs /
translated: Because in that way, that man would be protected by the king’s army.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rgyal po'i phyogs dpung dang ldan pa'i phyogs de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal po'i phyogs dpung dang ldan pa'i phyogs de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he would be protected by the king’s army, which is protected by the king.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems ni dpung dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brten to //
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems ni dpung dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brten to //
translated: In the same way, the mind of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has first given rise to the mind of awakening, and the mind of an irreversible bodhisattva, are like a side that has an army.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs dpung dang ldan pa'i @42a *//
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs dpung dang ldan pa'i @42a *//
translated: The side of omniscience is a side that has an army.

original: phyogs de la brten pas na /
analyzed: phyogs de la brten pas na /
translated: Because it has an army,

original: de nyan thos thams cad kyis zil gyis mnan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de nyan thos thams cad kyis zil gyis mnan par mi nus so //
translated: it cannot be overcome by any śrāvakas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dper na / skyes bu rgyal po la brten pa ni longs spyod zad par gyur kyang /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu rgyal po la brten pa ni longs spyod zad par gyur kyang /
translated: it is like a person who is supported by a king. Even if his wealth is exhausted,

original: 'on kyang tshugs par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshugs par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: nevertheless, he cannot be harmed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs la brten pa'ang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs la brten pa'ang /
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is supported by the side of omniscience

original: 'di ltar nyan thos thams cad dang / bdud thams cad kyis mi tshugs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos thams cad dang / bdud thams cad kyis mi tshugs so //
translated: cannot be harmed by any śrāvakas or any māras.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos thams cad kyis tshugs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos thams cad kyis tshugs par 'gyur /
translated: how is it that bodhisattvas are not overcome by all the hearers?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽gal te nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po / gal te nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,🔽if they proclaim and explain the level of the hearers

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa sgrogs shing 'chad pa na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa sgrogs shing 'chad pa na /
translated: and the level of the solitary buddhas,

original: de'i sems bskyed cing bdag kyang de ltar gyur cig ces sems bskyed na /
analyzed: de'i sems bskyed cing bdag kyang de ltar gyur cig ces sems bskyed na /
translated: and if they arouse the thought, ‘May I also become like that,’

original: nyan thos rnams kyis tshugs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis tshugs pa yin no //
translated: then they are overcome by the hearers.

original: gang de'i gtam gyi ro myong bar byed pa dang / de la yang dga' bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa bskyed pa des na tshugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang de'i gtam gyi ro myong bar byed pa dang / de la yang dga' bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa bskyed pa des na tshugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas who savor the taste of their teachings and delight in them are overcome by the hearers because they arouse inappropriate thoughts.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / ci'i phyir na /
translated: ” He replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de dag la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya /
analyzed: de dag la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya /
translated: why are they called ‘inappropriate thoughts’?🔽”

original: smras pa / 'di dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gegs byed pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gegs byed pa yin te /
translated: He replied, “These are obstacles to the omniscience of bodhisattva great beings.

original: 'di dag skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di dag skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: They do not give rise to it.

original: 'di dag ni @42b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ring bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni @42b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ring bar byed pa yin te /
translated: They make omniscience distant.

original: de bas na 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, these are called bodhisattvas’ improper mental activity.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽dper na / rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor spyod pa yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du bya bar 'dod cing /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po / dper na / rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor spyod pa yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du bya bar 'dod cing /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,🔽for example, the arising of desire, anger, and ignorance in yogins and yoginīs who practice yoga and wish to actualize the limit of reality

original: yang dag pa la nges par 'jug par 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug kun tu 'byung ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid ring bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa la nges par 'jug par 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug kun tu 'byung ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid ring bar byed pa yin te /
translated: and enter into reality makes the state of an arhat distant.

original: de dag de'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag de'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those are called their improper mental activity.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la'ang nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la'ang nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Likewise, the omniscience of bodhisattvas who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood is not like that of the śrāvakas.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa rnams gegs byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa rnams gegs byed pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, the mental activities associated with the disciples and the solitary sages are obstacles to the knowledge of an Omniscient One, for a bodhisattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yid la byed pa de dag bskyed na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos rnams kyis zil gyis non pa yin no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag bskyed na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos rnams kyis zil gyis non pa yin no //
translated: If he generates those mental activities, then in that case, the bodhisattva, the great being, is outshone by the disciples.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: He said, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de lta na byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos rnams kyis zil gyis non pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos rnams kyis zil gyis non pa yin te /
translated: in that case, the bodhisattva is outshone by the disciples.

original: gang nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gang nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: He who generates mental activities associated with the disciples

original: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa skyed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa skyed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
translated: or mental activities associated with the solitary buddhas is not called a bodhisattva.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid la byed pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i grangs @43a *//
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i grangs @43a *//
translated: Through these mental engagements, one is counted as a bodhisattva.🔽

original: su mi chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su mi chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of those attentions, they are not counted among the bodhisattvas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dper na / rgyun du zhugs pa nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod na sbyin gnas su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / rgyun du zhugs pa nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod na sbyin gnas su mi 'gyur te /
translated: for example, when a stream enterer engages in the afflictions, they are not a recipient of generosity.

original: gal te gang gis de'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i shes pa thob na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis de'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i shes pa thob na /
translated: But if they attain the knowledge that abandons those afflictions,

original: des de rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya bar rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des de rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya bar rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
translated: then they are distinguished as a stream enterer.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not distinguished by the afflictions.

original: de ltar na shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba la 'dris pas de rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba la 'dris pas de rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In that way, by knowing and being familiar with the abandonment of the afflictions, they are called stream enterers.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽in the same way, when bodhisattvas engage in the thoughts of the hearers and solitary buddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i sems kun tu spyod cing skye bas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i sems kun tu spyod cing skye bas /
translated: and are born from those thoughts,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes rab tu phye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes rab tu phye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the mind and mental factors that are the basis of the designation of a bodhisattva are called a bodhisattva.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag skye bas /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag skye bas / 'di lta ste /
translated: Rather, it is the arising of those mind and mental factors that are based on omniscience

original: de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: that is called a bodhisattva.🔽Therefore, it is the arising of those mind and mental factors that are based on omniscience that is called a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas na tshugs par mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas na tshugs par mi nus so //
translated: If a bodhisattva abides in the mind of awakening, he cannot be harmed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dper na / 'phong gi slob dpon ni gnas na 'dug kyang rung /
analyzed: dper na / 'phong gi slob dpon ni gnas na 'dug kyang rung /
translated: for example, it is difficult for enemies to harm an archery master whether he is standing still

original: 'gro'ang rung / dgra rnams kyis tshugs par dka' ba yin te; gzhan gyi mda' yang gcod cing bdag kyang srung ngo //
analyzed: 'gro'ang rung / dgra rnams kyis tshugs par dka' ba yin te; gzhan gyi mda' yang gcod cing bdag kyang srung ngo //
translated: or moving, and he can cut the arrows of others and protect himself.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa'ang tshugs @43b par dka'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa'ang tshugs @43b par dka'o //
translated: in the same way, it is difficult to harm a bodhisattva who abides in the mind of awakening.

original: nyan thos kyi spyod pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi spyod pa'am /
translated: whether they are the conduct of the hearers

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa thos na'ang 'di ltar bdag kyang myur ba nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa thos na'ang 'di ltar bdag kyang myur ba nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas / 'di lta ste /
translated: Having heard the conduct of the pratyekabuddhas, he dedicates [the merit] in this way: ‘May I too quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa da ltar nyan thos rnams la chos ston pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa da ltar nyan thos rnams la chos ston pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni now teaches the Dharma to the śrāvakas,

original: bdag kyang nyan thos rnams la chos ston par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag kyang nyan thos rnams la chos ston par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: may I too teach the Dharma to the śrāvakas.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: Venerable one,

original: de ltar na thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa la tshugs par mi nus te /🔽nyan thos kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: de ltar na thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa la tshugs par mi nus te / nyan thos kyi gtam mam /
translated: in that way, the bodhisattva skilled in means who abides in the thought of awakening cannot be overcome.🔽Whether hearing the teachings of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam thos na'ang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam thos na'ang /
translated: or the teachings of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: chos kyi gtam 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa las byung ngo zhes de bzhin gshegs pa dran par byed de /
analyzed: chos kyi gtam 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa las byung ngo zhes de bzhin gshegs pa dran par byed de /
translated: having heard them, he thinks of the Tathāgata, ‘This Dharma discourse arose from the Tathāgata.’

original: nyan thos rnams la chags pa mi skyed do //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la chags pa mi skyed do //
translated: He does not arouse attachment to the disciples.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa ni thub par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa ni thub par dka' ba yin no //
translated: in this way, the bodhisattva who abides in the mind of awakening is difficult to overcome.

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: Venerable One,

original: dper na / rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor spyod pa dmigs pa thob cing /
analyzed: dper na / rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor spyod pa dmigs pa thob cing /

analyzed: de'i spyod yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de nyid ni /
translated: That which is not his domain🔽is the domain of the śrāvakas and the domain of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de'i tshul khrims 'chal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshul khrims 'chal ba yin no //
translated: He is a bodhisattva who has transgressed morality.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' gal te khyim gyi gnas nas byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' gal te khyim gyi gnas nas byung bar gyur te /
translated: if a bodhisattva has gone forth from the home life,

original: de'ang tshul khrims gang dang / gang yang dag par bzung nas gnas pa de'ang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su mi bsngo na /
analyzed: de'ang tshul khrims gang dang / gang yang dag par bzung nas gnas pa de'ang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su mi bsngo na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: then that bodhisattva is not endowed with the morality of a bodhisattva.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa de ni /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa de ni /
translated: One who is not endowed with the morality of a bodhisattva

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
translated: should not be called a bodhisattva.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' khyim na gnas shing /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' khyim na gnas shing /
translated: If a bodhisattva lives in a home,

original: gsum la skyabs su song bar gyur la /
analyzed: gsum la skyabs su song bar gyur la /
translated: and has gone for refuge to the Three Jewels,

original: de'ang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo na de 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan rnams la longs spyod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de'ang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo na de 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan rnams la longs spyod du zin kyang /
translated: and if he dedicates to complete knowing, then even if he enjoys the five kinds of sensual pleasures,

original: de tsam gyis na de byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na de byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa /
translated: By that alone, one is abiding in the bodhisattva’s morality.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By just that much, he is said to be a bodhisattva who is established in morality, and he is said to be endowed with morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa de ni; tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa de ni; tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the bodhisattva’s morality is not separated from the perfection of morality.

original: gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He who is not separated from the perfection of morality is said to be not separated from omniscience.

original: @52b gzhan yang /
analyzed: @52b gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa rnams 'byung du zin kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa rnams 'byung du zin kyang /
translated: even though the bodhisattva’s desires and improper mental engagements arise,

original: de dag thams cad de'i thams cad mkhyen pa yid la byed pa'i sems gcig gis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad de'i thams cad mkhyen pa yid la byed pa'i sems gcig gis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: all of them are outshone by a single thought of his that is focused on omniscience.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang / nor bu rin po che bee d'urya ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang / nor bu rin po che bee d'urya ni /
translated: Moreover, a precious beryl gem

original: mching bu'i nor bu 'bum dag dang lhan cig tu bsres te bzhag na /
analyzed: mching bu'i nor bu 'bum dag dang lhan cig tu bsres te bzhag na /
translated: If it is placed together with a hundred thousand glass gems,

original: nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i rin thang med pa dang / kha dog bzang po dang / 'od kyis mching bu'i nor bu de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i rin thang med pa dang / kha dog bzang po dang / 'od kyis mching bu'i nor bu de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: the priceless, beautiful, and radiant vaiḍūrya gem outshines them all.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de dag thams cad kyang /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i sems gcig bskyed pas zil gyis gnon par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i sems gcig bskyed pas zil gyis gnon par rig par bya ste /
translated: in the same way, you should know that a single thought of a bodhisattva who possesses roots of virtue connected with omniscience outshines all those improper mental activities.

original: ji ltar mching bu'i nor bu de dag nor bu rin po che bee d'urya gcig gis zil gyis non cing lam mer ma gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mching bu'i nor bu de dag nor bu rin po che bee d'urya gcig gis zil gyis non cing lam mer ma gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as those glass gems are outshone by the single vaiḍūrya gem and do not shine,

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' mtshan rnams 'dod cing sbyin pa byin na spyod yul ma yin pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' mtshan rnams 'dod cing sbyin pa byin na spyod yul ma yin pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: if a bodhisattva gives a gift with a desire for the marks, he is practicing in a domain that is not his own.

original: gang de'i spyod yul ma yin pa thams cad ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang de'i spyod yul ma yin pa thams cad ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And whatever is not his domain should be understood as a domain of immorality.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: byang chub sems dpas mtshan rnams 'dod pas sbyin pa byin par mi bya yi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas mtshan rnams 'dod pas sbyin pa byin par mi bya yi /
translated: a bodhisattva should not give a gift with a desire for the marks.

original: @53a *// thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pas sbyin pa byin par bya'o //
analyzed: @53a *// thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pas sbyin pa byin par bya'o //
translated: He should give a gift with a desire for the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gang la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa de la ni mtshan rnams yod do //
analyzed: gang la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa de la ni mtshan rnams yod do //
translated: For whoever has the knowledge of all aspects has the marks.

original: de la ni mi 'jigs pa rnams yod do; ;de la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams yod pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du yod do //
analyzed: de la ni mi 'jigs pa rnams yod do; ;de la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams yod pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du yod do //
translated: Whoever has the knowledge of all aspects has the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha, and so on up to: whoever has the knowledge of all aspects has all the buddhadharmas.

original: de ltar na de'i sbyin pa ni mchog tu bzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i sbyin pa ni mchog tu bzung ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus his giving is not held to be supreme.

original: gang gi tshe mchog tu ma bzung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mchog tu ma bzung ba de'i tshe /
translated: When one does not grasp at the highest,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: then one takes up the perfection of morality.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pas sbyin pa byin par byed na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pas sbyin pa byin par byed na /
translated: if a bodhisattva who desires omniscience practices generosity,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin nam /
translated: is that not grasping at the highest with respect to omniscience?

original: gang dang / gang la mchog tu 'dzin pa de nyid de'i tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dang / gang la mchog tu 'dzin pa de nyid de'i tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Whatever one grasps at as the highest is the grasping at the highest with respect to morality and spiritual discipline.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni yul na gnas pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni yul na gnas pa'am /
translated: Pūrṇa replied, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: phyogs na gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs na gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: this omniscience does not exist in a place or a region.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni gzugs sam /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni gzugs sam /
translated: Omniscience is not form,🔽feeling,

original: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
translated: perception,

original: 'du byed rnams sam /🔽rnam par shes pa'ang ma yin no //🔽'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sam / rnam par shes pa'ang ma yin no // 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: or mental processes.🔽It is not conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it unconditioned.

original: tshad yod pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad yod pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is not limited.

original: de ni mchog tu gzung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni mchog tu gzung bar mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be grasped as supreme.

original: chos gang yang dmigs su med de /
analyzed: chos gang yang dmigs su med de /
translated: No dharma can be apprehended.

original: gang dmigs su med pa @53b de ni yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gang dmigs su med pa @53b de ni yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: What cannot be apprehended does not exist.

original: med pa'ang ma yin te /🔽gang yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin te / gang yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: med pa'ang ma yin pa ni mchog tu gzung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin pa ni mchog tu gzung bar mi nus so //
translated: What is neither existent nor nonexistent cannot be grasped as supreme.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa!

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byin nam /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byin nam /
translated: Therefore, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices generosity

original: tshul khrims srung zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo na /
translated: and protects morality, dedicating it all to omniscience,🔽he does not grasp morality and ritual as supreme.

original: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin no; ;gal te'ang tshul khrims de nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin no; ;gal te'ang tshul khrims de nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: If he were to dedicate that morality to the level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngo na /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: he would grasp morality as supreme.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims las nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims las nyams pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva would fall from the bodhisattva’s morality.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar nyams pa phyir bslang bar nus sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar nyams pa phyir bslang bar nus sam /
translated: can a bodhisattva who has fallen be restored?”

original: smras pa / gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du ma byas la gal te bden pa rnams ma mthong na phyir yang bslang bar nus so //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du ma byas la gal te bden pa rnams ma mthong na phyir yang bslang bar nus so //
translated: He replied, “If the limit of reality is not actualized, and if the truths are not seen, then he can be restored again.”

original: yang smras pa /🔽'di la tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa / 'di la tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: He said,🔽“Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
translated: a bodhisattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o //
translated: should not actualize the limit of reality.”

original: smras pa / ci'i phyir /🔽smras pa / nyan thos kyi sa 'am /
analyzed: smras pa / ci'i phyir / smras pa / nyan thos kyi sa 'am /
translated: He asked, “Why is that?”🔽He replied, “So that he does not fall to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur du 'ong pa'i phyir te /🔽nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i skal @54a *//
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur du 'ong pa'i phyir te / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i skal @54a *//
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level,

original: ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who is on the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level is not fortunate enough to arouse the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: gal te de chos nub par gyur ba'i tshe byung na ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob par rang byang chub mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de chos nub par gyur ba'i tshe byung na ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob par rang byang chub mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to arise when the Dharma has disappeared, then he would realize individual enlightenment without attaining omniscience.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: rgyu 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug par ma gyur gyi bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byar ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug par ma gyur gyi bar du yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byar ma gnang ngo //
translated: for this reason, too, the Tathāgata did not allow the realization of the very limit of reality until the bodhisattva had sat down at the site of awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: Moreover, if a bodhisattva, while practicing the perfection of morality,

analyzed: tshul khrims de sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir mngon par mi sgrub na /
translated: does not cultivate that morality in order to benefit all sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: then the bodhisattva does not possess the perfection of morality.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems can tshad yong pa rnams kyi ched du sbyin pa byin nam /
translated: if a bodhisattva gives gifts for the sake of a limited number of sentient beings,

original: tshul khrims srung na /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung na /
translated: or protects morality,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: he does not embrace the perfection of morality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the perfection of morality is not limited.

original: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims gang yin /
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims gang yin /
translated: It was said, “What is the bodhisattva morality of a bodhisattva?”

original: smras pa / sbyin pa gang dang / gang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims srung ba de thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar byed na /
analyzed: smras pa / sbyin pa gang dang / gang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims srung ba de thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar byed na /
translated: It was said, “If he dedicates all his giving and all his protection of morality to omniscience,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub sems @54b dpa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub sems @54b dpa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: that is the bodhisattva morality of a bodhisattva.”

original: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du tshul khrims bsgom pa'i phyir spyod la /
analyzed: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du tshul khrims bsgom pa'i phyir spyod la /
translated: If a bodhisattva practices for as many eons as there are sand particles in the Ganges River in order to cultivate morality,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su mi bsngo na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su mi bsngo na /
translated: If they do not dedicate to omniscience,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin no //🔽gal te nyan thos nyid dam /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin no // gal te nyan thos nyid dam /
translated: they do not take up the perfection of morality.🔽If they do not dedicate to the state of a śrāvaka

original: rang sangs rgyas nyid du'ang yongs su mi bsngo na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas nyid du'ang yongs su mi bsngo na /
translated: or to the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: de ltar na'ang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na'ang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: then, in that case, they do not take up the perfection of morality.

analyzed: des tshul khrims 'chal par yang mi brtsi'o // gal te nyan thos kyi sa 'am /
translated: They are not counted as having faulty morality.🔽If they dedicate to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngo na /
translated: or to the pratyekabuddha level,

original: de tsam gyis na de tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na de tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya'o //
translated: then, to that extent, they are said to have faulty morality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di lta ste /
